org.json.stream

Class JSONStreamReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.json.stream.JSONStreamReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSONLimitStreamReader

    public class JSONStreamReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads a JSON document as a stream of JSON events. Uses an iterator model to produce each event. Similar to a StAX event model in XML processing.

    For a streaming equivalent for writing JSON data, see the JSONWriter and JSONStringer classes.

    A simple example of how to use this class:

     JSONStreamReader reader = new JSONStreamReader(JSON_TEXT);

 while(reader.hasNext()) {
     ParseState state = reader.nextState();
     switch(state) {
         case KEY:
             System.out.println("KEY = " + reader.nextKey() );
             break;
         case NULL_VALUE:
         case BOOLEAN_VALUE:
         case NUMBER_VALUE:
         case STRING_VALUE:
             System.out.println(state + " = " + reader.nextValue());
             break;
         default:
             System.out.println(state);
     }
 }

    A more complete example can be found by reading the JSONObjectBuilder source code.

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Are there more parse states remaining in the source stream.
        Returns:
        true if there are more parse states remaining, otherwise false

      • nextState

        public JSONStreamReader.ParseState nextState()
                                      throws JSONException
        Advance the parser onto the next state in the source stream, and return a JSONStreamReader.ParseState representing the state that was encountered.
        Returns:
        one of the ParseState values
        Throws:
        JSONException - there was a problem with the source stream

      • nextKey

        public java.lang.String nextKey()
                         throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.KEY, return the text of the key name.

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        the parsed text of the key
        Throws:
        JSONException - there was a problem with the source stream

      • nextValue

        public java.lang.Object nextValue()
                           throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.NULL_VALUE, JSONStreamReader.ParseState.BOOLEAN_VALUE, JSONStreamReader.ParseState.NUMBER_VALUE, or JSONStreamReader.ParseState.STRING_VALUE, return the value as an Object. The values that can be returned here are:
        • JSONObject.NULL
        • Boolean.TRUE or Boolean.FALSE
        • A Double, Long, Integer, BigInteger, or BigDecimal
        • A String

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        an Object of the type described above
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • nextStringValue

        public java.lang.String nextStringValue()
                                 throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.STRING_VALUE, return the value as a String.

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        a String value
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • appendNextStringValue

        public <T extends java.lang.Appendable> T appendNextStringValue(T writer)
                                                         throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.STRING_VALUE, append the decoded value to the given Appendable.

        This method is suitable for cases where very long String data is expected, for instance for base-64 encoded data.

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of Appendable, returned to the caller
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer to which the String value will be written
        Returns:
        the given Appendable object
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • nextBooleanValue

        public boolean nextBooleanValue()
                         throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.BOOLEAN_VALUE, return the value as a boolean.

        If the JSON value is not parseable as a boolean, as defined by the JSON grammar, a JSONException will be thrown.

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        a boolean value
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • nextNullValue

        public java.lang.Object nextNullValue()
                               throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.NULL_VALUE, return the value as a NULL object.

        If the JSON value is not parseable as a null, as defined by the JSON grammar, a JSONException will be thrown.

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        the JSONObject.NULL value
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • nextNumberValue

        public java.lang.Number nextNumberValue()
                                 throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.NUMBER_VALUE, return the value as a Number.

        The number type returned is one of:

        • A Double
        • A Long
        • An Integer
        • A BigDecimal
        • A BigInteger

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        a value that is a subclass of the Number class
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • appendNextNumberValue

        public <T extends java.lang.Appendable> T appendNextNumberValue(T writer)
                                                         throws JSONException
        If the ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.NUMBER_VALUE, append the number sequence to the given Appendable.

        This method is suitable for cases where the caller wishes to perform their own conversion of number values into a corresponding Object type.

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of Appendable, returned to the caller
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer to which the number sequence will be written
        Returns:
        the given Appendable object
        Throws:
        JSONException

        This method advances the parser onto the next state.

        Returns:
        a number value as a BigDecimal class
        Throws:
        JSONException

                                 throws JSONException

      • decodeInt

        protected int decodeInt(java.lang.String val,
                        boolean isDbl)
                 throws JSONException
        Parse a number as an int strictly according to the JSON specification. No coercion of double or long values.
        Parameters:
        val - the String value to be decoded as an int
        isDbl - true to indicate the value is a decimal or exponent value, otherwise false
        Returns:
        the number represented by the token sequence
        Throws:
        JSONException
